label: 4AD
description:
South London band Dry Cleaning's follow-up to their well-received 2021 debut "New Long Leg" is unashamedly British - sardonic, self-deprecating, poetic, earthy, pessimistic - which would be something to cherish if it wasn't so devoid of life. Maybe it's all we deserve.

It doesn't take more than a few seconds to isolate exactly where Dry Cleaning are coming... more

label: Midgar
description:
Finally, a vinyl version of Susumu Yokota’s ‘Acid Mt. Fuji’ [1994], the 2nd album of ambient-acid-techno by the Japanese legend who sadly passed away in 2015

Delivered via Germany’s Midgar, Acid Mt. Fuji arrives on vinyl at a high point of interest surrounding Yokota's work, and especially these early recordings that were made some years before he went on to... more

label: 4AD
description:
The Breeders' biggest selling and probably most-loved album, larely due to the massive success of Canonball.

It's a more easy-going, sometimes humorous and without question hooky set, and although for us it never quite hit the same visceral spot as Pod or Safari, you just cant argue with an album that's at once so singular and life affirming...

Classic.

description:
Natalie Mering's fifth album is an open-hearted, devotional suite of dreamy, Laurel Canyon-inspired pop - one for fans of Joni Mitchell, Patsy Cline, or Aimee Mann.
